thread.title: Tottenham 2 Chelsea 0: Mauricio Pochettino hails two-goal wonder Dele Alli after he throws Spurs back into the title race

author: leeastley
title: Tottenham 2 Chelsea 0: Mauricio Pochettino hails two-goal wonder Dele Alli after he throws Spurs back into the title race

organizations.name: news group newspapers ltd dele alli

text:
EFL Positive Poch Tottenham 2 Chelsea 0: Mauricio Pochettino hails two-goal wonder Dele Alli after he throws Spurs back into the title race 
The midfielder's headed double stopped the Blues sealing an unprecedented 14th straight top-flight win By PAUL JIGGINS Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MAURICIO POCHETTINO saw Dele Alli ruin Chelsea’s record hopes and said: “We’re now in the title race.” Tottenham fans sang the praises after man of the match performance from Alli Tottenham 2-0 Chelsea : Dele brace takes Tottenham up to third in the league 
Victory moved Spurs up to third in the Premier League table — seven points behind leaders Chelsea. 
Pochettino said: “It was important for us to reduce the gap. Now the top four is very competitive, very close. 
“This is only one game but it showed we can be competitive and achieve big things.” 
It was a sweet victory for Spurs after a 2-2 draw at Stamford Bridge ended their title hopes last season. 
Pochettino said: “We are very pleased because the most important thing for us was to show great character and to be very competitive. 
“Maybe the problem last season was we didn’t know how to compete in a better way and we suffered against a good team like Chelsea. 
“But this was a very solid performance and I’m so proud of this.” Getty Images Alli rose above Chelsea's defence to score his second header of the game related stories Thug calls ambulance for HIMSELF after punching woman so hard he dislocated his shoulder hot gym kit fits the bill With millions making New Year's resolutions to get in shape, we put supermarket gear through its paces ROD LIDDLE Max Mosley and Martin Hickman's quest to sue newspapers for printing the truth? I'm not Impressed THE LEND IS NIGH Brit's consumer debt grows at fastest rate in ten years and 'alarm bells should be ringing,' charities warn 'SHE'S TERRIFIED' Jennifer Lopez files restraining order against 'violent stalker' who has left her 'fearing for her life' keith's mike kind of guy Sports Direct's Mike Ashley expected to support chairman Keith Hellawell after vote on his future 
He now has seven goals in his last four matches — including a brace in each of the last three. 
Pochettino said: “For me, he’s one of the best English talents that appeared in the last two years and he is showing his potential.” 
Dele, 20, said: “We had to fight. It was big for us and the fans but we stuck to the gameplan. 
“I’m happy to get the goals but it was hard. This was a massive game, there was no hiding how big it was. Pedro and Diego Costa have a disagreement on the pitch as Chelsea lose 2-0 News Group Newspapers Ltd Dele Alli scored two headers to break Chelsea hearts 
“A lot went into it. We fought from first whistle to last.” 
Chelsea boss Antonio Conte said: “We’re disappointed but also must be pleased with our run. 
“To win 13 games in a row is not easy in this league. And we lost to a very good team. 
“Tottenham are one of the six teams that can fight until the end to win the title or find a place in the Champions League.” Check out all the action from the Premier League in our midweek review
